article.title: The EDGE-CALIFA Survey: Interferometric Observations of 126 Galaxies with CARMA

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the blue channel in the figure represent?
What is the significance of the red circles in the figure?
choices: Galaxies with both D and E array CARMA observations
Galaxies with only E array CARMA observations
Galaxies with high WISE 22 Âµm flux

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the median Rayleigh-Jeans brightness temperature sensitivity of the EDGE observations?
What can be said about the CARMA EDGE sample compared to the CALIFA sample based on this figure?
choices: EDGE is perfectly representative of CALIFA in all parameters.
EDGE samples a broader range of galaxy masses than CALIFA.
EDGE galaxies have a bias towards higher star formation rates and metallicities than CALIFA.
EDGE does not include any galaxies with low metallicities.
